titles.title: An original joint resolution disapproving the certification by the President under section 481(h) of the Foreign Assistance Act of 1961.

calendar.text: Committee on Foreign Relations ordered to be reported an original measure in lieu of S.J.Res. 279.

action.text: Committee on Foreign Relations. Original measure reported to Senate by Senator Pell. Without written report.

calendar.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 610.

action.text: Measure laid before Senate by motion.

vote.text: Failed of passage in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 40-53. Record Vote No: 96.

bill.summary: 4/12/1988--Introduced. Disapproves the President's certification for U.S. assistance to the Bahamas under provisions of the Foreign Assistance Act of 1961 relating to countries that fail to take adequate measures to prevent narcotic drugs and other controlled substances from being sold illegally within the jurisdiction of such country to U.S. Government personnel or from entering the United States unlawfully.
